definitions.definition: To enlarge an object by pushing air (or a gas) into it; to raise or expand abnormally
examples: You inflate a balloon by blowing air into it.

definitions.definition: To enlarge by filling with air (or a gas).
examples: The balloon will inflate if you blow into it.
to inflate somebody with pride or vanity

definitions.definition: To decompress (data) that was previously deflated .
To represent something as being more important, better, or worse than it actually is; to exaggerate .
examples: Israel routinely claims that the Gaza Ministry of Health, which is run by Hamas, has a tendency to inflate the number of Palestinian casualties in the Gaza Strip.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To enlarge an object by pushing air (or a gas) into it; to raise or expand abnormally
secondary_definitions: ( intransitive ) To enlarge by filling with air (or a gas).
( figurative ) To swell ; to puff up.
( transitive , computing ) To decompress (data) that was previously deflated .
( figurative , transitive ) To represent something as being more important, better, or worse than it actually is; to exaggerate .
